type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"NewsArticle","mainEntityOfPage":"https://www.timesnownews.com/india/objectionable-comment-on-lord-ram-swami-prasad-maurya-booked-for-hurting-hindu-sentiments-article-99281471","url":"https://www.timesnownews.com/india/objectionable-comment-on-lord-ram-swami-prasad-maurya-booked-for-hurting-hindu-sentiments-article-99281471","articleBody":"Lucknow: Samajwadi Party leader Swami Prasad Maurya has been booked for allegedly making an \"objectionable comment on Lord Ram\" and hurting religious sentiments of Hindus during a public programme attended by party president Akhilesh Yadav in Uttar Pradesh's Rae Bareli. The Uttar Pradesh Police registered an FIR against the SP leader.Maurya was charged under IPC Section 295-A (deliberate and malicious acts, intended to outrage religious feelings of any class by insulting its religion or religious beliefs).The FIR was registered against Swami Prasad Maurya after Hindu Yuva Vahini worker Marut Tripathi filed a complaint alleging that SP MLC's comments were vitiating the atmosphere and leading to a communal flare-up.Tripathi filed the complaint after a video of Maurya saying \"Mile Mulayam-Kanshi Ram, hawa ho gaye Jai Shri Ram\", went viral on social media.The complainant said that the Samajwadi Party leader's alleged comment hurt the religious sentiments of the \"Sanatani\" society and will disturb the social harmony of society.Meanwhile, Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) supremo Mayawati hit out at Samajwadi Party, saying \"It has been the nature of SP to do politics of casteist hatred and baseless issues instead of development and public interest of UP.\"The SP MLC opined that there was no need for an FIR against him for his comment.\"I will explore my legal options. I don't want to politicise the issue but the government is working with hostility nowadays,\" he alleged.Earlier, Swami Prasad Maurya had kicked off a huge controversy by alleging that certain verses of the 'Ramcharitmanas' \"insult\" a large section of society and demanded ban on such writings. Samajwadi Party leader Swami Prasad Maurya has been booked for allegedly making an \"objectionable comment on Lord Ram\" and hurting religious sentiments of Hindus during a public programme attended by party president Akhilesh Yadav in Uttar Pradesh's Rae Bareli. The Uttar Pradesh Police registered an FIR against the SP leader.Maurya was charged under IPC Section 295-A (deliberate and malicious acts, intended to outrage religious feelings of any class by insulting its religion or religious beliefs).The FIR was registered against Swami Prasad Maurya after Hindu Yuva Vahini worker Marut Tripathi filed a complaint alleging that SP MLC's comments were vitiating the atmosphere and leading to a communal flare-up.Tripathi filed the complaint after a video of Maurya saying \"Mile Mulayam-Kanshi Ram, hawa ho gaye Jai Shri Ram\", went viral on social media.The complainant said that the Samajwadi Party leader's alleged comment hurt the religious sentiments of the \"Sanatani\" society and will disturb the social harmony of society.Meanwhile, Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) supremo Mayawati hit out at Samajwadi Party, saying \"It has been the nature of SP to do politics of casteist hatred and baseless issues instead of development and public interest of UP.\"The SP MLC opined that there was no need for an FIR against him for his comment.\"I will explore my legal options. I don't want to politicise the issue but the government is working with hostility nowadays,\" he alleged.Earlier, Swami Prasad Maurya had kicked off a huge controversy by alleging that certain verses of the 'Ramcharitmanas' \"insult\" a large section of society and demanded ban on such writings. He joined the BJP in presence of Union Minister Pralhad Joshi and other party leaders.Welcoming Reddy to the BJP, Joshi said he will strengthen the party's fight against corruption and that his decision would be a \"big boost\" for the party in Andhra Pradesh.\"Many members of Kiran Kumar Reddy's family were in Congress. When I met him some time ago, he told me that he was influenced by Prime Minister Narendra Modi. Today he is taking a big leap and joining the BJP. He will strengthen our fight against corruption because his image as an MLA and minister has been very clean. It will be a big boost for BJP in Andhra Pradesh,\" Joshi said.Kiran Reddy's sharp attack at CongAfter joining the BJP, Reddy launched a scathing attack at the Congress leadership. \"My family's association with Congress started in 1950s. I never imagined I will have to leave Congress. Due to bad decisions of the Congress high command, the party is getting damaged in all states..they don't interact with people, don't discuss with people. In every state this is happening,\" he said.\"There is a saying- 'My king is very intelligent, he doesn't think on his own, doesn't listens to anyone's advice,\" he said.","cmstype":"ARTICLE","status":"ACTIVE","title":"Ex-Andhra CM Kiran Kumar Reddy joins BJP weeks after quitting Congress","cmssource":"CMSLITE","parenttitle":"India","titleforurl":"ex-andhra cm kiran kumar reddy joins bjp weeks after quitting congress","synopsis":"After joining the BJP, Kiran Kumar Reddy launched a scathing attack at the Congress leadership.             if(__getCookie('privacy-policy') && __getCookie('privacy-policy') === '1') {

            }
            if (typeof(COMSCORE) !== "undefined" && typeof(COMSCORE.beacon) === "function") {
              COMSCORE.beacon({...objComScore,...comScoreToPassed});
            }
          };
          if (window.TimesGDPR && TimesGDPR.common.consentModule.gdprCallback) {
            TimesGDPR.common.consentModule.gdprCallback(function(dataObj) {
              if (dataObj.isEUuser) {

              _comscore.push(objComScore);

            });
          } else{
            let comScoreValue = ''
            if(__getCookie('privacy-policy') && __getCookie('privacy-policy') ==='1') {
              comScoreValue = '1'
            }
            objComScore["cs_ucfr"] = comScoreValue;
            _comscore.push(objComScore);
            loadComscore();
          }

main.articleBody: Lucknow: Samajwadi Party leader Swami Prasad Maurya has been booked for allegedly making an "objectionable comment on Lord Ram" and hurting religious sentiments of Hindus during a public programme attended by party president Akhilesh Yadav in Uttar Pradesh's Rae Bareli. The Uttar Pradesh Police registered an FIR against the SP leader.Maurya was charged under IPC Section 295-A (deliberate and malicious acts, intended to outrage religious feelings of any class by insulting its religion or religious beliefs).The FIR was registered against Swami Prasad Maurya after Hindu Yuva Vahini worker Marut Tripathi filed a complaint alleging that SP MLC's comments were vitiating the atmosphere and leading to a communal flare-up.Tripathi filed the complaint after a video of Maurya saying "Mile Mulayam-Kanshi Ram, hawa ho gaye Jai Shri Ram", went viral on social media.The complainant said that the Samajwadi Party leader's alleged comment hurt the religious sentiments of the "Sanatani" society and will disturb the social harmony of society.Meanwhile, Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) supremo Mayawati hit out at Samajwadi Party, saying "It has been the nature of SP to do politics of casteist hatred and baseless issues instead of development and public interest of UP."The SP MLC opined that there was no need for an FIR against him for his comment."I will explore my legal options. I don't want to politicise the issue but the government is working with hostility nowadays," he alleged.Earlier, Swami Prasad Maurya had kicked off a huge controversy by alleging that certain verses of the 'Ramcharitmanas' "insult" a large section of society and demanded ban on such writings.
main.headline: 'Objectionable comment on Lord Ram': Swami Prasad Maurya raised the slogan in presence of Akhilesh Yadav
main.keywords: swami prasad maurya,akhilesh yadav,uttar pradesh police,lord ram,swami prasad maurya news,
